repnme.cdata!: Philippines - Reform Program For Government Corporations

abstracts.cdata!:
The Reform Program for Government
            Corporations Project constitutes the foundation stage for
            phased structural adjustment of the public corporate sector.
            It focusses on the Non Financial Government Corporations
            (NFGC's). The program is composed of three key
            elements. First, the establishment of a policy framework
            which enunciates ground rules for the establishment of
            Government Corporations (GC's). Second, a
            rationalization program to correct anomalies in the existing
            public sector corporate portfolio and ensure an appropriate
            disposition of all GC's; this includes privatization,
            consolidation, conversion to private non-profit status,
            transfer to departments or abolition of GCs. Third, an
            institutional framework for improved operations and
            monitoring of the corporations remaining in the public
            sector; this includes clarification of the roles of
            Government entities dealing with GCs, improvement of their
            supervision and control, establishing of corporate planning
            and performance evaluation systems, and improving the
            accounting and auditing of GCs. Measures to improve the
            performance of the retained GCs will initially be
            implemented by 15 of the largest NFGCs.
